KPK Kasasi ke MA secara serius, terkait Pembebasan Sofyan Basir
05 Nov 2019, 22:12 by Chairul Umam


KPK Kasasi ke MA secara serius, terkait Pembebasan Sofyan Basir

KBRN, Jakarta : Mantan Direktur Utama PT PLN Sofyan Basir telah bebas dari rutan kpk pada hari senin 4 november 2019 . Sofyan Basir bebas setelah Pengadilan Negeri Tindak Pidana korupsi memvonis bebas mantan dirut pln tersebut.
Menanggapi hal tersebut , juru bicara KPK Febri Diansyah mengungkapkan, KPK semaximal mungkin akan melakukan perlawanan hukum dengan melakukan kasasi ke mahkamah agung secara serius.
"Memang berbeda pandangan dengan Majelis Hakim, KPK semaximal mungkin akan melakukan perlawanan hukum dengan melakukan kasasi ke mahkamah agung secara serius," ungkap Febri di gedung KPK, Jakarta Selatan, Selasa (05/11/2019).
Lebih lanjut febri menyatakan, ada bukti2 yang kpk pandang belum di pertimbangkan oleh hakim, menurut KPK, sofyan basir pernah menyampaikan keterangan sebagai saksi terkait adanya kepentingam Eni Saragih terkait pendanaan kegiatan parpol.
"Pandang kami lihat belum di pertimbangkan oleh Hakim, karena sebenarnya Sofyan Basir pernah menyampaikan keterangan sebagai saksi terkait adanya kepentingam Eni Saragih terkait pendanaan kegiatan parpol," ungkap Febri.
Dalam sidang kemarin, Sofyan sebelumnya dinyatakan tidak bersalah melanggar Pasal 12 huruf a juncto Pasal 15 Undang-Undang (UU) Pemberantasan Tipikor juncto Pasal 56 Ke-2 KUHP dan Pasal 11 juncto Pasal 15 UU Pemberantasan Tipikor juncto Pasal 56 Ke-2 KUHP.
Dia tidak terbukti memfasilitasi pemberian suap dari pengusaha Johanes Budisutrisno Kotjo kepada mantan anggota DPR, Eni Maulani Saragih dan mantan Mensos Idrus Marham.
Sofyan basir juga telah dikeluarkan dari rumah tahanan kpk atas permintaan Hakim.

The Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) has taken the Supreme Court seriously regarding Liberation of Sofyan Basir
05 Nov 2019, 22:12 by Chairul Umam


The Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) has taken the Supreme Court seriously regarding Liberation of Sofyan Basir

KBRN, Jakarta: Former Managing Director of PT PLN Sofyan Basir has been released from prison in the city on Monday 4 November 2019. Sofyan Basir was released after the Corruption District Court sentenced the former president director of the pln.
Responding to this, KPK spokesman Febri Diansyah revealed, the KPK will do its utmost legal resistance by taking an appeal to the Supreme Court seriously.
"It is different from the view of the Panel of Judges, the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) will seriously oppose the law by appealing to the Supreme Court seriously," Febri said at the KPK building, South Jakarta, Tuesday (11/05/2019).
The febri further stated, there was evidence that the viewpoint had not yet been considered by the judge, according to the KPK, Sofyan Basir had delivered information as a witness related to the interests of Eni Saragih related to funding political party activities.
"We see that the Judge has not been considered, because actually Sofyan Basir has delivered information as a witness related to the interests of Eni Saragih related to funding political party activities," said Febri.
In yesterday's hearing, Sofyan was previously found not guilty of violating Article 12 letter a juncto Article 15 of the Act (Elimination of Anti-Corruption Law) in Article 56 of the Second Criminal Code and Article 11 in conjunction with Article 15 of the Law on Eradication of Corruption Act in conjunction with Article 56 of the 2 Criminal Code.
He was not proven to facilitate the granting of bribes from businessman Johanes Budisutrisno Kotjo to former DPR members, Eni Maulani Saragih and former Social Minister Idrus Marham.
Sofyan Basir has also been removed from the detention center at the request of the Judge.
